fields.summary: Allow a page restore to restore parent/child relationships

fields.description: When you underline text in a page and save it, you are unable to remove the underlining by clicking on the button or with Ctrl+U. You can remove it by deleting the underline tags in the wiki markup.
fields.summary: Unable to remove underlining via the Rich text editor.

fields.description:
I attempt to move a page to another space.  The page owner does not have an email address in their AD profile.  Notification fails so page cannot be moved.

Should catch error instead of killing process, please.  Error is below.

System Error
A system error has occurred - our apologies!

Please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
   2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
   3. attach the application server log file (if possible). 

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

fields.summary: No email address in LDAP causes page editing/movement to fail if user is watching
LogoBlock no longer goes to your site default home page

fields.description: It would be nice if the state of the page tree in the space browser would be remembered across navigation. e.g. which subtrees were expanded etc. An "expand all" button would also be very useful.
fields.summary: Remember state of the page tree in the space browser
Allow selection of favourite pages in the RSS feed builder

fields.description:
Currently when you're viewing the differences between two revisions of a page, you see the whole page in the diff output, even if there for example was only one small change at the bottom. (the same is true for automatically generated notification emails)

It would be nice if Confluence could output only the changed lines in context of a few unchanged lines, like e.g. the Unix diff tool does. The diff is nice, but if you have to scroll down the whole page to see what actually was changed it sort of loses a lot of it's usefulness. The notification emails would also be much easier to read.
fields.summary: Visual page diff tool: Only display that part of a diff that actually has changes
Allow configuration of search results display
Anonymous users can restrict searches to non-existent favourite spaces without error

fields.description:
Create a page A which uses the {include} macro to include a page B that has an image attached to it.
When using the export to PDF functionality, and exporting individual page B, the resulting PDF file contains the image within as expected.
However, when exporting page B (that refers to page A and it's content) the resulting PDF file only contains the textual information obtained from page A. No images are exported as a part of page A.

See comment from Alan here http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Include+Page+Macro
fields.summary: Exporting page to PDF omits images from the {include} pages

fields.description: This causes an NPE on Extranet.
fields.summary: Dynamic tasklist atlassian-plugin.xml lists components in the wrong order

fields.summary: Tree view in browse space fails with NPE

fields.description:
Perhaps as an admin action.

This is to help people who upgrade by restoring a backup without attachments and then move their attachments folder manually afterwards. 

The consequence is the upgrade task responsible for renmaing the attachments under the new scheme does not get run.
fields.summary: Expose the attachment rename upgrade task

fields.description: I would like to use Confluence for product spec documents. Confluence currently creates a new version each time a page is saved. Throughout the life cycle of a document, editors may save changes hundreds of times. I was wondering if there was a way to manually set/flag "major" versions of a page. Also, it would also be helpful to see what has changed in the rich text view as opposed to the wiki markup view.
fields.summary: Version management

fields.description:
The rich text editor doesn't work with certain browser/OS combinations. Another compatibility matrix for you:

|| || Win || MacOS || Linux ||
| *IE* | (+) | | (x) |
| *Firefox* | (+) | (+) | (+) |
| *SeaMonkey* | (-) | (+) | (+) |
| *Opera* | (+) | (-) | (-) |
| *Netscape* | (+) | (+) | |
| *Safari* | (x) | (-) | |
| *Konqueror* | (x) | | (-) |

(Browsers and Operating Systems with the most recent versions)
(+): works
(-): doesn't work
(X): not applicable
fields.summary: The rich text editor doesn't work with certain browser/OS combinations

fields.description: Under Space - Advanced - Undefined Pages you don't see pages that contain {include}s to non-existent pages.
fields.summary: Non-existing {include}s not listed in non-existing pages list

fields.description: When a page name changes (e.g. through renaming it), pages that {include} the page using the include macro don't get updated. These includes break.
fields.summary: Page names in {include}s don't get changed when page name changes

fields.description: If you create a new page and include another page using the {include} macro and click on preview, you get a red box containing "Unable to render {include} Couldn't find a space with key: null". Only after you saved the page the include will work.
fields.summary: include-macro fails if page hasn't been saved yet

fields.description:
On some browsers and platforms, we constantly have a horizontal scrollbar in our web interface which seems unnecessary, since there isn't anything to scroll to. Screen resolution also doesn't matter.

We created a compatibility matrix for you in WikiMarkup:
|| || Win || MacOS || Linux ||
| *IE* | (+) | | (x) |
| *Firefox* | (-) | (-) | (-) |
| *SeaMonkey* | (-) | (-) | (-) |
| *Opera* | (+) | (+) | (+) |
| *Netscape* | (-) | (-) | |
| *Safari* | (x) | (+) | |
| *Konqueror* | (x) | | (+) |

(+): works, no scrollbar
(-): bug, has scrollbar
(X): not applicable
fields.summary: Unnecessary horizontal scrollbar

fields.description:
The merge algorithm when resolving concurrent edits seems to destroy Umlauts (possibly other non-ascii-characters as well). How to reproduce:

Assume you have a page with content "asdfäöü".

User 1 then clicks on edit and waits. User 2 clicks on edit, adds a line, lets say "jkl;" and saves. User 1 then clicks on save too (although he didn't change anything), and the page's content becomes "asdf&#xFC&#xFD&#xFE" (or whatever the LATIN1-codes for Umlauts are). Seems that the merge algorithm destroyed the umlauts.
fields.summary: Merge algorithm reliably destroys Umlauts

fields.description:
Certain escapes get lost after saving a page in the RichText-Editor (it doesn't happen in the Wikitext-Editor). For example: 

we enter in the Wikitext-Editor: \@asdf@ in order to get "@asdf@" in the page (literally, not as template text field)
if we now edit the page again and switch to RichText-Editing, the RichText-Editor converts it to @asdf@ which, when saved, is being rendered as a template text field. The escape gets lost.
fields.summary: Escapes get lost when saved in the RichText-Editor

fields.description: Atter exporting the whole content from the "Advanced" Tab in the "Space Details" page, the links in PDF or HTML documents are not working when they are made from the macro "{contentbylabel}".
fields.summary: Links generated by the ContentByLabel-Macro are broken in PDF-exports

fields.description: Reference issue for a bunch of fixed issues to be shipped with Confluence 2.3.
fields.summary: Uninstall bad plugins, enforce module load order, enable/disable modules themselves

fields.description:
For example, if Confluence is accessed for the first time at https://www.example.com/confluence, the baseUrl will be set to https://www.example.com:443/confluence.

When the baseUrl is looked up from the request (such as during set up, or during an upgrade), Confluence puts an unnecessary port 443 in the URL if it starts with https. Port 443 is the standard port for HTTPS, so should be removed.
fields.summary: Base URL derived from request includes unnecessary port 443

fields.description:
The search finds details about the user in the space description and the personal information object. Therefore will give back two results for one single user. 

It appears that the personal information objects are not deleted when a space is converted into a personal space, only on creation of a new space. We will have to delete the personal information objects on convert and add an upgrade task to remove personal information objects if a user has a personal space.
fields.summary: People Directory number of found users does not match the number of actual users displayed
Listing news items doesn't provide intuative way for editing them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6415].
  {panel}

Hi,

There is interesting thread at http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=11768&tstart=0 where Mike Corn has suggested a feature in confluence by which we can restrict the attachment quota.

Users has tendency to put everything (including big powerpoint presentations, pdfs, executable) as part of wiki attachments. And many times it's seen that those attachments are not removed and they stay there forever; putting lots of work on bakup process. In order to prevent this problem; right now we have lowered the attachment size limit (2MB) and asked user to use file storage for any bigger attachments.

I guess having inbuilt control on space quota (so that users can't add any new data till some unused get removed) will be good way to restrict/remove unwanted stuff lying there forever!

-
Rajendra
fields.summary: Attachment Quota per space

fields.description: I used the vote macro on my profile page to set up a little survey.  It works fine, except when I Edit the page.  Every time I hit the Edit link on the page, it reformats the vote macro, putting it all on one line.  And apparently the macro uses returns as the delimiter in order to determine where answers begin and end.  So, whenever I hit Edit, my survey gets broken.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor removes linebreaks and destroys the Vote Macro

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/User+Lister+-+1.4+series+only

In version 2.2.3, the Userlister plugin does not highlight which users are actually logged in. It does list the correct userlist for the group, but fails to highlight the users currently logged in.
fields.summary: User Lister Plugin -  not highlighting active users

fields.description:
Some image URLs don't get the baseurl prepended correctly. For example, try a charting portlet.

Turns out this is where single quotes are used around the href or src attribute values in the portlet.
fields.summary: Jiraportlet URL munging doesn't work properly for links with single quotes

fields.description: This makes the font-size shrink when the portlet is displayed.

fields.description: Individual plugin modules can be stateaware, so they know when they're enabled / disabled.
fields.summary: Make plugin modules state aware

fields.description: Ehcache needs to be shutdown properly in the context listener. Fixed in HEAD by making CaptchaManager a disposable bean (as Captcha is the only thing which currently uses ehcache).
fields.summary: Ehcache not properly shut down

fields.description:
The decorators were moved from the filesystem to the database. We will have to make sure that upgrade as well as backup and restore is still working.

For backups we will have to keep in mind that decorators can come from 2 locations now. In 2.3+ the decorators will be stored in entities.xml whereas in previous versions, the decorators are simple text files stored in the backup zip.
fields.summary: Ensure upgrade tasks for decorators are working.
Unexpected behaviour with multiple escape characters in editors
Users from LDAP do not appear in people directory or search results until they have logged in

fields.description: Allow users to add comments throughout the page, not just at the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: Allow in-line comments

fields.description:
Add an image attachment, display the thumbnail, delete it, attach another with the same name, view the thumbnail -- it's the same as the old one.
(note also that thumbnails still use attachment file names as the thumbnail file name)
fields.summary: Thumbnails are not regenerated when attachments change

fields.description: When mail is excluded from a search, the number of hits which occurred in mai items should be presented to the user. This doesn't happen anymore.
fields.summary: excluded mail count no longer works

fields.description: But seems to work inside User Macros
fields.summary: Variable declared inside confluence velocity context plugin is not accesible in layouts
None latin character attachment names get corrupted when downloaded as "download all", using Windows

fields.description: The {calendar} macro saves all-day events into the day prior to the one selected e.g. all day event saved for Sept 22nd gets saved to Sept 21st.
fields.summary: Calendar Macro incorrectly saves all day events

fields.description:
The RSS feed does not support HTTPS feeds. Confirmed that Thunderbird can access the feed while the same URL in Confluence results in an error.

--- Error when accessing a test HTTPS feed ---
rss: Unable to retrieve https://feed_url_here Could not download: https://feed_url_here - javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target 

--- Error when accessing a test HTTP feed that serves HTTPS feed ---
rss: Error parsing RSS feed: java.io.IOException: Invalid XML rssoutput-1798436319.txt
fields.summary: RSS macro fails on HTTPS SSL feeds

fields.description:
Each user should be able to edit or remove his own comments.  Sometimes people put the comment in the wrong place, or want to fix a point that they have made (they hit the "Post" button too soon).

However, only administrators can remove a comment, and no one is allowed to edit a comment.

Please allow a user to edit or remove his/her own comments, but no one else's.
fields.summary: Make it possible for a user to edit or remove his/her own comments
Display user's navigation history on a navigation bar

fields.description:
(Re discussion with Charles)

A couple times someone's put 50 images as attachments to a page and included them on the page. After this, the person's sent an email to the whole company advertising the page, causing between 100 to 200 people to hit the page at the same time. This causes the Confluence installation to become so slow it's unusable. Other services on the same server seem unaffected even during this flash crowd so I think it's caused by some kind of a thread starvation within Confluence.

Charles: Permissions have to be checked on each attachment. Which means a database hit. Which means you quickly run out of connections and everything is waiting on the connection pool to free up. You could probably alleviate it somewhat by increasing the size of the db pool.
fields.summary: Attachment loading scalability improvement

fields.description:
I''ve upgraded our confluence wiki from version 2.0 to 2.2.3 because of the ldap integration that is now present.
Our instance has 1 wiki user and 2 wiki groups (confluence-admin and confluence-users). All other users en groups/roles come out of our active directory. There are some problems with the current version however ...

1. Restrict page in edit mode only displays the 2 wiki groups and not the ldap groups, although if you know the names of the groups from ldap, you can use them and it works. So only real wiki groups get shown in the popup for restrict view/edit ...

2. If you have a public viewable subspace, anonymous users who are not logged in can browse through the various pages. When you login however, and you are not explicitly allowed to view the subspace (as a user or group you are a member of), you cannot see the public subspaces. We find that not logical at all ...

3. The wiki group atlassian-users should contain all users within the confluence instance, however, our active directory users are not automatically member of this group, hence they cannot login until you mark their groups within the global permissions administration section (when you create a new subspace you can indicate that all users should be able to view the space, this is currenty implemented as the group atlassian-users can view the space, but ldap users are not a member of this group ...)
fields.summary: LDAP/AD integration
Improve usability for creating links to network files
Allow to switch Confluence to read-only mode

fields.description:
When you change the default properties for thumbnail size, only the newly attached thumbnails will be effected. The size of the thumbnails that are already part of your space will remain unchanged.

In order for you to enable the already existing thumbnails size to be changed, you need to first remove them from thumbnail directory under Confluence Home "thumbnails" directory. Then reattach them again after you changed the thumbnail with and height under Administration >  General Configuration > Attachment Settings.
fields.summary: Global Thumbnail Settings don't effect existing thumbnail proportions

fields.description: Markup is attached, visible only to Atlassian
fields.summary: Table markup mangled by IE, OK in Firefox

fields.description: This tab should be invisible
fields.summary: Space admin tab is visible to non-space admins
{html-include} does not preserve styles of included pages

fields.description: There are a bunch of new indexing languages available in the version of Lucene we're running, but they don't appear in the UI.

fields.description: For non admin users, personal spaces will be shown in the space picker used for the feed builder.
fields.summary: Personal spaces appear in space picker (feed builder)

fields.description: When you search for a Japanese string (say 2 kanji characters), the search results should not include hits where only one of the characters is matched. The 2 characters is a unique string (a word) and only full matches to this string should be included in the search results. Please see attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Search for Japanese strings should not include partial matches
Add service to get a page at a specific version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6377].
  {panel}

Hi

It would be handy to be able to create blog posts using the Metaweblog (or other well-established blogging) XML-RPC API. This would mean that desktop clients like ecto, MarsEdit, wbloggar, etc, would be able to create blog entries with minimal fuss. Imagine how useful this would be in personal spaces!

Cheers

Miles
fields.summary: Blog posts via Metaweblog API

fields.description: See this forum thread: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=101&threadID=11740
fields.summary: Can't create personal spaces for LDAP users who have never logged in

fields.description:
Looking at the screenshot I took of the people directory, I realised that putting peoples usernames in the search results wasn't just useless information, it was actually distracting. We should just go with full names.

(Unless full-name is blank, then fall back to username)
fields.summary: Remove usernames from people directory

fields.description:
When diffing pages, the output is incorrect in some cases.  It appears to mark the right lines as a change, yet displays the wrong contents of those lines.

For example (simulation follows):

-JIRA (issue tracking)
-Confluence
-Fisheye (SVN changeset
-Crucible (online code-review tool)
+JIRA (bug and issue tracking, project management)
+Confluence
+Fisheye (SVN changeset
+Crucible (online code-review tool)

is the correct set of lines, yet the actual text of the Crucible line in that version of the document is "Crucible (online peer code-review tool)".

See attached images for the diff, then the older, and newer versions of that part of the markup.

(our live URL with this example is:  http://framework.zend.com/wiki/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=162&originalId=177 from version 3 to version 4)
fields.summary: Page DIFFs produce incorrect output (examples provided)
Option for making page-edit comments mandatory
Roll back attachment entry in database if attachment file upload attempt fails

fields.description:
When you add new lines in a Wiki Markup and then change to a RT view, the new lines added are not persistent.
To enforce the new line in RT, one way is to add at least two explicit line breaks.  

text
\\
\\
text

(Please note that this will however, not resolve the problem with rendered HTML i.e. the explicit line breaks are ignored. I've noticed this erroneous behaviour when working with lists)
fields.summary: New line not persistent between Rich TextT and Wiki Markup

fields.description: I can't finish the confluence installation. The last step "create admin account", i become the following error message (see attachment).
fields.summary: can't finish installation...
Manual Page Referesh needed to see data items in the Dynamic Tasklist Macro

fields.description:
Support inline Comments within a page.

This would allow users to refer to a specific piece of content instead of the complete page.
fields.summary: Inline Comments

fields.description:
Out the box, the first thing a unix user will experience is:

jturner@teacup:~/tmp/confluence-2.2-std/bin$ ./startup.sh
bash: ./startup.sh: Permission denied

Running chmod +x *.sh fixes this.

This should be easy to fix by setting the filemode attribute in the <zip> task:

http://ant.apache.org/manual/CoreTypes/zipfileset.html

More from the Ant docs:

> Starting with Ant 1.5.2, <zip> can store Unix permissions inside the archive (see description of the filemode and dirmode attributes for <zipfileset>). Unfortunately there is no portable way to store these permissions. Ant uses the algorithm used by Info-Zip's implementation of the zip and unzip commands - these are the default versions of zip and unzip for many Unix and Unix-like systems.

Maven 1.0.3 comes with Ant 1.5.3, so this should work.
fields.summary: Make shell scripts executable in Confluence distribution

fields.description: People with personal spaces do not appear in people directory search. The reason is that the if the user does not have have view permissions on the personal space of the users, the spaces and therefore the results will be excluded.
fields.summary: People with personal spaces do not appear in people directory search

fields.description:
There are a lot of these showing up in c.a.c's stdout.log

2006-06-15 02:05:06,966 ERROR [atlassian.confluence.util.XWorkTransactionInterceptor] onThrowable(Lcom/opensymphony/xwork/ActionInvocation;Lorg/springframework/transaction/interceptor/TransactionAttribute;Lorg/springframework/tr
ansaction/TransactionStatus;Ljava/lang/Throwable;)V Invoking rollback for transaction on action '/pages/listpages-alphaview.action (AlphabeticalListPagesAction.execute())' due to throwable: org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammar
Exception: Bad SQL grammar [] in task 'Hibernate operation'; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: operator does not exist: bigint = bytea
org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: Bad SQL grammar [] in task 'Hibernate operation'; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: operator does not exist: bigint = bytea
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: operator does not exist: bigint = bytea
fields.summary: Postgres error in alphabetical page views on confluence.atlassian.com

fields.description: Confluence users with eyesight disabilities cannot use the browser's accessibility controls (e.g. text size control) to make the page body text larger, because Confluence uses fixed rather than relative font sizes.  The use of fixed font sizes violates almost every existing standard and/or guideline on web site accessibility.
fields.summary: Use relative font sizes for page text

fields.description:
If you create a news item with a '/' in the name, you get an error.

The problem that I have with this is:

- the error doesn't tell you what the problem is
- the error isn't internationalized
- there is no indication before you submit that there will be a problem (ie that '/' is a special character)
fields.summary: Error creating news

fields.description: My builds which had been taking about 6 hours and producing a 1.6Gb file quit finishing.  The past two nights I have tried to run them manually and last night I turned on logging (found from another issue) for the backup process.  It appears the backup is never finishing.  Confluence has been sluggish for the past few days as well.  I assume this is because the backup is running and never finishing.  I have attached the logs from last night.
fields.summary: Backups have not completed for 5 days

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6356].
  {panel}

I suggest one that is thing about restore action.

restore progress bar action is stop after 30 min on VPN connect!!!!

so I refresh page... And next action is ... oh, no.... new restore action.... OTL

(content indexing is possible refresh action to view new progress status after start indexing)

so, I want to button that is refresh progress bar.
fields.summary: about restore action page's progress bar refresh action

fields.description:
Right now the WebWorkVelocityServlet extends the VelocityServlet which actually means the Velocity core gets loaded twice into memory. Uses about 12 MB on my machine, and by changing it to load once we save about 6MB of real memory. 

Fairly easy patch - let's fix it in the stable build.
fields.summary: Wasting memory - Velocity is loaded twice

fields.description: The comment remove event does not get thrown.
fields.summary: Comment remove event not thrown

fields.description:
A page remove event is currently only thrown when a page gets deleted from the trash. The same is true for news items. 

We will have to create a page trashed and restore event.
fields.summary: Add trashed and restore events for pages and news

fields.description:
In v 1.3.x we were using a color macro inside an excerpt macro.   Worked great.

In v.2.2.1a, we noticed that the color macro was not rendered, but rather just displayed in the excerpt text with the macro tag included. UGH.  Worked bad!

Dave Loeng mentioned in a Forum posting reply  that he reproduced this problem and confirmed it to be a regression from fixing an excerpt macro bug.
fields.summary: Nested Macro does not render correctly
Attachments macro should allow listing attachments from another page

fields.description: I edited the welcome message to be a simple one liner, it stays for a few seconds then reverts back to the default message.
fields.summary: Welcome message resetting to default

fields.description:
Currently, creating pages including screenshots requires pasting the screenshot into a picture editor, saving the picture and inserting in into confluence.

Could Confluence include a small, java based picture editor, when adding an image in Confluence?

1. Click on Insert/Edit Image
2. Click on Paste Clipboard, which opens java based editor
3. Paste clipboard to editor
4. Click Save and Insert, which saves the pasted picture and uploads it to Confluence

Would greatly improve efficiency when creating documents.

Cheers!

Tolga
fields.summary: Support for Pasting Screenshots/Images from Clip Board
Add "More..." hyperlink to excerpted blog-post entries

fields.description: Insert/Edit Image button missing when adding a new page with Rich Text Editor. Once the page has been added and edited, the option is available.
fields.summary: Insert/Edit Image button missing when adding a new page with Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
After the extranet upgrade, I've got a bunch of people listed as favourites in the people directory, but can't understand how they got there.

How, for example, "Phantom Ross User" ended up being a favourite, I have no idea.

I'm not touching my favourites for the time being, so you can use them as test data to track down the problem.
fields.summary: Seemingly random people listed as favourites in the people directory

fields.description:
Upon restricting access to a page, a group name has to be entered.  Upon viewing a restricted page, the groups a logged-in user belongs to are checked against the group entered to restrict access to.

Currently, comparison of a user's groups to the entered one appears to be case sensitive.

That is very non-intuitive, especially when you are faster entering group names by hand (disregarding capitalization) than by click-selecting them. Even more, if the group names are defined outside Confluence.  Also, it creates confusion and support issues.

Please change comparison of group names upon restricting access to pages to be non-case-sensitive.
fields.summary: Page restrictions based on group names should be case-insensitive

fields.description: I'm not able to log on server, on http://localhost:8080, using username=admin and password=admin
fields.summary: Confluence File  Uploader: failed to logon server

fields.description: When  {excerpt} macro includes calls to another macro, for example {attachments},  those calls are shown as plain text. When the {excerpt-include} macro shows the except text, it triggers any macro calls instead of displaying them in plain text. The behaviour is inconsistent.
fields.summary: body of an excerpt macro is not rendered in a page but rendered when included in other macros such as excerpt-include

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6341].
  {panel}

When I'm making a really quick change, it's a pain to have to scroll down to check off the 'minor change' box when there is a save button tantalizingly placed right at the top of the window...

I'm sure the whole point of having the save button in two places is  to avoid the hassle of scrolling so I'd like to see this to make the simple case even simplier.  At least it is only one extra click:
Edit 
Check minor change
Fix Typo
Alt-S
fields.summary: Move minor change toggle

fields.description:
All blogs list content in reverse-created order. The blog-posts macro should do likewise.

Provide an option to order by modification, but make the default order-by creation, since we're making the macro behave correctly.
fields.summary: blog-posts macro should sort by creation date, not modification date

fields.description:
Default Velocity resource loader should use an expiring cache. It is currently implemented using a HashMap in ConfluenceVelocityResourceCache.

Some issues that need to be resolved:
- Velocity rendering during bootstrap can't access normal caches (i.e. Tangosol), which are set up later
- caching strategy to use - time vs. size limited
fields.summary: Velocity cache never gets cleared

fields.description:
We have two groups of users using Confluence (via LDAP):

1. internal users with uid=<name> (e.g. uid=administrator) are shown properly
2. customers with uid=<email address> (e.g. uid=administrator@domain.com) are not shown with the userlister macro

Additional info: both user types can login and are shown under the "Manage users" administration section.
fields.summary: userlister macro does not show all LDAP users

fields.description:
Many times in Confluence we would like to simply reference one or more JIRA issues and have the issue ID render with strikethrough if the issue is resolved, much like it does in JIRA.  This would allow us to reference JIRA issues next to each of our Business Requirements in Confluence and be able to see at a glance which requirements have been resolved instead of having to refer to separate tables.  

Right now we have a table with requirements in Confluence that reference the JIRA issues for each requirement in a JIRA Issues column.  But we have to use the Multi-Issue plugin to display a separate table of JIRA issues below the requirements table so we can see the status of each issue.  In this case, we're really just interested in whether the issue has been resolved or not.
fields.summary: Need plugin renders list of JIRA issues complete with strikethrough for resolved issues

fields.description:
Supress Password link and Change My Password page in user profile when LDAP authentication is being used.

It's misleading to users to offer to allow them to attempt to change their password when doing so has no effect.

Maybe the same applies with other forms of external authentication.
fields.summary: Hide change password option if LDAP authentication is being used

fields.description: The user e-mail preference, Notify For My Own Actions, is not being saved to the database.  As a result, this value is lost on a Confluence server restart.
fields.summary: Notify For My Actions value is not being saved to the os_propertyentry table

fields.description:
When implementing PLUG-18, it became clear that it would be better architectually to have the ModuleDescriptor's trigger the module object classes' StateAware interface code as it would allow them to retain the control and better determine how instanciation / triggering takes place. This means that the modules in confluence which override the enabled/disabled() methods will need to call super.enabled/disabled() (or otherwise trigger the module object) in order for them to work as planned.

The confluence and atlassian-plugins patches can be applied separately, with only the confluence patch depending on the plugins patch (and not visa versa).
fields.summary: State Aware Plugin Module Descriptors

fields.description:
Under certain circumstances it is possible to make changes to the global permission settings even though the user is not allowed to administrate Confluence. 

The problem will be solved in Confluence 2.2.3. but we highly recommend to apply the existing patch to older instances of Confluence.
fields.summary: Security problem in permission editing

fields.description: The ability to update JIRA issues from a Confluence page would enhance Atlassian's product integration and provide a useful timesaving feature.
fields.summary: update JIRA issues from a Confluence page
